name: Super Ultra Action Battle Cats
description:
A little never-ending Beat 'em up + Action Adventure for the Scratch Game Jam #2

Not a full game yet, but you can beat up some Yellow Belts to dream up a new scene 🥋 Idea is that you'll start at White Belt and defeat opponents to go up in rankings, unlocking new skills and weapons.

---
Genre: Beat 'em up + Action Adventure
Game Inspiration: Double Dragon
---

MOVE LIST

  • Move with WASD
  • Fight with Arrow keys
    • ▶️ Jab (hold to keep jabbing)
    • ▶️▶️ One-two
    • ▶️▶️🔼 Uppercut
    • 🔽 Low kick
    • 🔽▶️ Side kick (chainable with high kicks)
    • 🔽🔼 High kick

ATTRIBUTIONS

  • Cat sprites by DogChicken on OpenGameArt: https://opengameart.org/content/cat-fighter-sprite-sheet
  • Backgrounds imagined with Stable Diffusion: https://lexica.art/prompt/cdbe855d-db5b-4216-81c1-7833c65545f9

GET THE CODE

A last minute bug prevented it from working fast on Gandi/Scratch, but you can view and remix the code on TurboWarp: https://turbowarp.org/815858778/editor

REMIX NOTES (more notes coming soon)

This game is designed to be easy and fun to remix (though maybe not quite yet), and you're free to use it however you'd like. Using generative AI and img2img you can quickly create new levels or dream up entirely different vibes in minutes!

  • All pixels are stamped with Pen tool, making it easy add custom styles and effects!
  • Uses First Class Lists architecture to make extending sprites with new abilities and effects easy to do
  • Logic is organized in Sprite "hierarchies":
    • Stage Manager controls the overall game state like how and when to generate rooms and NPCs
    • Layers controls the parallax and Sprite stamping order
    • NPCs is where the AI goes
    • Inputs: Cat handles inputs (from player or eventually AI), animation, and final Sprite stamping
  • If you'd like to layer sprites in other parallax planes besides the one the player is in (for example, for background or foreground characters) then understanding this video may help
